attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: The default series type for the chart. Can be one of line, spline, area, areaspline, column, bar, pie and scatter. Defaults to "line".
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: An explicit width for the chart. By default the width is calculated from the offset width of the containing element. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: width

attribute.description: An explicit height for the chart. By default the height is calculated from the offset height of the containing element. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: Height

attribute.description: The margin between the top outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingTop. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: marginTop

attribute.description: The margin between the right outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingRight. Defaults to 50.
attribute.name: marginRight

attribute.description: The margin between the top outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingTop. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: marginBottom

attribute.description: The margin between the left outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingLeft. Defaults to 80.
attribute.name: marginLeft

attribute.description: Name of the serie to display.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: The horizontal alignment of the title. Can be one of "left", "center" and "right". Defaults to "center".
attribute.name: align

attribute.description: When the title is floating, the plot area will not move to make space for it. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: floating

attribute.description: The margin between the title and the plot area, or if a subtitle is present, the margin between the subtitle and the plot area. Defaults to 15.
attribute.name: margin

attribute.description: The title of the chart. To disable the title, set the text to null. Defaults to "Chart title".
attribute.name: text
style

attribute.description: The vertical alignment of the title. Can be one of "top", "middle" and "bottom". Defaults to "top".
attribute.name: verticalAlign

attribute.description: The x position of the title relative to the alignment within chart.spacingLeft and chart.spacingRight. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: x

attribute.description: The y position of the title relative to the alignment within chart.spacingTop and chart.spacingBottom. Defaults to 15.
attribute.name: y

attribute.description: The horizontal alignment of the title. Can be one of "left", "center" and "right". Defaults to "center".
attribute.name: align

attribute.description: When the title is floating, the plot area will not move to make space for it. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: floating

attribute.description: The title of the chart. To disable the title, set the text to null. Defaults to "Chart title".
attribute.name: text
style

attribute.description: The vertical alignment of the title. Can be one of "top", "middle" and "bottom". Defaults to "top".
attribute.name: verticalAlign

attribute.description: The x position of the title relative to the alignment within chart.spacingLeft and chart.spacingRight. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: x

attribute.description: The y position of the title relative to the alignment within chart.spacingTop and chart.spacingBottom. Defaults to 15.
attribute.name: y

attribute.description: Whether to show the credits text. Defaults to true.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.description:
Position configuration for the credtis label. Supported properties are align, verticalAlign, x and y. Defaults to
position: { align: 'right', x: -10, verticalAlign: 'bottom', y: -5 }
attribute.name: position

attribute.description: The URL for the credits label. Defaults to "http://www.highcharts.com".
attribute.name: href
style

attribute.description: The text for the credits label. Defaults to "Highcharts.com".
attribute.name: text

attribute.description: Whether to allow decimals in this axis' ticks. When counting integers, like persons or hits on a web page, decimals must be avoided in the axis tick labels. Defaults to true.
attribute.name: allowDecimals

attribute.description: When using an alternate grid color, a band is painted across the plot area between every other grid line. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: alternateGridColor

attribute.description:
If categories are present for the xAxis, names are used instead of numbers for that axis. Example:
categories: ['Apples', 'Bananas', 'Oranges']
Defaults to [].
attribute.name: categories

attribute.description:
For a datetime axis, the scale will automatically adjust to the appropriate unit. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat. Defaults to:
{ second: '%H:%M:%S', minute: '%H:%M', hour: '%H:%M', day: '%e. %b', week: '%e. %b', month: '%b \'%y', year: '%Y' }
attribute.name: dateTimeLabelFormats

attribute.description: Whether to force the axis to end on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis end. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: endOnTick

attribute.description: Color of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area. Defaults to "#C0C0C0".
attribute.name: gridLineColor

attribute.description: The dash or dot style of the grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration. Defaults to Solid.
attribute.name: gridLineDashStyle

attribute.description: The width of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: gridLineWidth

attribute.description: The color of the line marking the axis itself. Defaults to "#C0D0E0".
attribute.name: lineColor

attribute.description: The width of the line marking the axis itself. Defaults to 1.
attribute.name: lineWidth

attribute.description: Color of the minor, secondary grid lines. Defaults to #E0E0E0.
attribute.name: minorGridLineColor

attribute.description: The dash or dot style of the minor grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration. Defaults to Solid.
attribute.name: minorGridLineDashStyle

attribute.description: Width of the minor, secondary grid lines. Defaults to 1.
attribute.name: minorGridLineWidth

attribute.description: Color for the minor tick marks. Defaults to #A0A0A0.
attribute.name: minorTickColor

attribute.description:
Tick interval in scale units for the minor ticks. On a linear axis, if "auto", the minor tick interval is calculated as a fifth of the tickInterval. If null, minor ticks are not shown.
On logarithmic axes, the unit is the power of the value. For example, setting the minorTickInterval to 1 puts one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. Setting the minorTickInterval to 0.1 produces 9 ticks between 1 and 10, 10 and 100 etc. A minorTickInterval of "auto" on a log axis results in a best guess, attempting to enter approximately 5 minor ticks between each major tick. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: minorTickInterval

attribute.description: The pixel length of the minor tick marks. Defaults to 2.
attribute.name: minorTickLength

attribute.description: The position of the minor tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside. Defaults to outside.
attribute.name: minorTickPosition

attribute.description: The pixel width of the minor tick mark. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: minorTickWidth

attribute.description: The distance in pixels from the plot area to the axis line. A positive offset moves the axis with it's line, labels and ticks away from the plot area. This is typically used when two or more axes are displayed on the same side of the plot. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: offset

attribute.description: Whether to display the axis on the opposite side of the normal. The normal is on the left side for vertical axes and bottom for horizontal, so the opposite sides will be right and top respectively. This is typically used with dual or multiple axes. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: opposite

attribute.description: Whether to reverse the axis so that the highest number is closest to origo. If the chart is inverted, the x axis is reversed by default. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: reversed

attribute.description: Whether to show the first tick label. Defaults to true.
attribute.name: showFirstLabel

attribute.description: Whether to show the last tick label. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: showLastLabel

attribute.description: For datetime axes, this decides where to put the tick between weeks. 0 = Sunday, 1 = Monday. Defaults to 1.
attribute.name: startOfWeek

attribute.description: Whether to force the axis to start on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis start. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: startOnTick

attribute.description: Color for the main tick marks. Defaults to #C0D0E0.
attribute.name: tickColor

attribute.description:
The interval of the tick marks in axis units. When null, the tick interval is computed to approximately follow the tickPixelInterval on linear and datetime axes. On categorized axes, a null tickInterval will default to 1, one category. Note that datetime axes are based on milliseconds, so for example an interval of one day is expressed as 24 * 3600 * 1000.
On logarithmic axes, the tickInterval is based on powers, so a tickInterval of 1 means one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. A tickInterval of 2 means a tick of 0.1, 10, 1000 etc. A tickInterval of 0.2 puts a tick on 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 20, 40 etc. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: tickInterval

attribute.description: The pixel length of the main tick marks. Defaults to 5.
attribute.name: tickLength

attribute.description: For categorized axes only. If "on" the tick mark is placed in the center of the category, if "between" the tick mark is placed between categories. Defaults to "between".
attribute.name: tickmarkPlacement

attribute.description: If tickInterval is null this option sets the approximate pixel interval of the tick marks. Not applicable to categorized axis. Defaults to 72 for the Y axis and 100 for the X axis.
attribute.name: tickPixelInterval

attribute.description: The pixel width of the major tick marks. Defaults to 1.
attribute.name: tickPosition

attribute.description: The type of axis. Can be one of "linear", "logarithmic" or "datetime". In a datetime axis, the numbers are given in milliseconds, and tick marks are placed on appropriate values like full hours or days. Defaults to "linear".Try it: "linear", "datetime" with regular intervals, "datetime" with irregular intervals, "logarithmic", "logarithmic" with minor grid lines, "logarithmic" on two axes.
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: Whether to allow decimals in this axis' ticks. When counting integers, like persons or hits on a web page, decimals must be avoided in the axis tick labels. Defaults to true.
attribute.name: allowDecimals

attribute.description: When using an alternate grid color, a band is painted across the plot area between every other grid line. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: alternateGridColor

attribute.description:
If categories are present for the xAxis, names are used instead of numbers for that axis. Example:
categories: ['Apples', 'Bananas', 'Oranges']
Defaults to [].
attribute.name: categories

attribute.description:
For a datetime axis, the scale will automatically adjust to the appropriate unit. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat. Defaults to:
{ second: '%H:%M:%S', minute: '%H:%M', hour: '%H:%M', day: '%e. %b', week: '%e. %b', month: '%b \'%y', year: '%Y' }
attribute.name: dateTimeLabelFormats

attribute.description: Whether to force the axis to end on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis end. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: endOnTick

attribute.description: Color of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area. Defaults to "#C0C0C0".
attribute.name: gridLineColor

attribute.description: The dash or dot style of the grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration. Defaults to Solid.
attribute.name: gridLineDashStyle

attribute.description: The width of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: gridLineWidth

attribute.description: The color of the line marking the axis itself. Defaults to "#C0D0E0".
attribute.name: lineColor

attribute.description: The width of the line marking the axis itself. Defaults to 1.
attribute.name: lineWidth

attribute.description: Color of the minor, secondary grid lines. Defaults to #E0E0E0.
attribute.name: minorGridLineColor

attribute.description: The dash or dot style of the minor grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration. Defaults to Solid.
attribute.name: minorGridLineDashStyle

attribute.description: Width of the minor, secondary grid lines. Defaults to 1.
attribute.name: minorGridLineWidth

attribute.description: Color for the minor tick marks. Defaults to #A0A0A0.
attribute.name: minorTickColor

attribute.description:
Tick interval in scale units for the minor ticks. On a linear axis, if "auto", the minor tick interval is calculated as a fifth of the tickInterval. If null, minor ticks are not shown.
On logarithmic axes, the unit is the power of the value. For example, setting the minorTickInterval to 1 puts one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. Setting the minorTickInterval to 0.1 produces 9 ticks between 1 and 10, 10 and 100 etc. A minorTickInterval of "auto" on a log axis results in a best guess, attempting to enter approximately 5 minor ticks between each major tick. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: minorTickInterval

attribute.description: The pixel length of the minor tick marks. Defaults to 2.
attribute.name: minorTickLength

attribute.description: The position of the minor tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside. Defaults to outside.
attribute.name: minorTickPosition

attribute.description: The pixel width of the minor tick mark. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: minorTickWidth

attribute.description: The distance in pixels from the plot area to the axis line. A positive offset moves the axis with it's line, labels and ticks away from the plot area. This is typically used when two or more axes are displayed on the same side of the plot. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: offset

attribute.description: Whether to display the axis on the opposite side of the normal. The normal is on the left side for vertical axes and bottom for horizontal, so the opposite sides will be right and top respectively. This is typically used with dual or multiple axes. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: opposite

attribute.description: Whether to reverse the axis so that the highest number is closest to origo. If the chart is inverted, the x axis is reversed by default. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: reversed

attribute.description: Whether to show the first tick label. Defaults to true.
attribute.name: showFirstLabel

attribute.description: Whether to show the last tick label. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: showLastLabel

attribute.description: For datetime axes, this decides where to put the tick between weeks. 0 = Sunday, 1 = Monday. Defaults to 1.
attribute.name: startOfWeek

attribute.description: Whether to force the axis to start on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis start. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: startOnTick

attribute.description: Color for the main tick marks. Defaults to #C0D0E0.
attribute.name: tickColor

attribute.description:
The interval of the tick marks in axis units. When null, the tick interval is computed to approximately follow the tickPixelInterval on linear and datetime axes. On categorized axes, a null tickInterval will default to 1, one category. Note that datetime axes are based on milliseconds, so for example an interval of one day is expressed as 24 * 3600 * 1000.
On logarithmic axes, the tickInterval is based on powers, so a tickInterval of 1 means one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. A tickInterval of 2 means a tick of 0.1, 10, 1000 etc. A tickInterval of 0.2 puts a tick on 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 20, 40 etc. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: tickInterval

attribute.description: The pixel length of the main tick marks. Defaults to 5.
attribute.name: tickLength

attribute.description: For categorized axes only. If "on" the tick mark is placed in the center of the category, if "between" the tick mark is placed between categories. Defaults to "between".
attribute.name: tickmarkPlacement

attribute.description: If tickInterval is null this option sets the approximate pixel interval of the tick marks. Not applicable to categorized axis. Defaults to 72 for the Y axis and 100 for the X axis.
attribute.name: tickPixelInterval

attribute.description: The pixel width of the major tick marks. Defaults to 1.
attribute.name: tickPosition

attribute.description: The type of axis. Can be one of "linear", "logarithmic" or "datetime". In a datetime axis, the numbers are given in milliseconds, and tick marks are placed on appropriate values like full hours or days. Defaults to "linear".Try it: "linear", "datetime" with regular intervals, "datetime" with irregular intervals, "logarithmic", "logarithmic" with minor grid lines, "logarithmic" on two axes.
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: The horizontal alignment of the legend box within the chart area. Defaults to "center".
attribute.name: align

attribute.description: The background color of the legend, filling the rounded corner border. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: backgroundColor

attribute.description: The color of the drawn border around the legend. Defaults to #909090.
attribute.name: borderColor

attribute.description: The border corner radius of the legend. Defaults to 5.
attribute.name: borderRadius

attribute.description: The width of the drawn border around the legend. Defaults to 1.
attribute.name: borderWidth

attribute.description: Enable or disable the legend. Defaults to true.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.description: When the legend is floating, the plot area ignores it and is allowed to be placed below it. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: floating

attribute.description: The width for each legend item. This is useful in a horizontal layout with many items when you want the items to align vertically. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: itemWidth

attribute.description: The layout of the legend items. Can be one of "horizontal" or "vertical". Defaults to "horizontal".
attribute.name: layout

attribute.description: Whether to reverse the order of the legend items compared to the order of the series or points as defined in the configuration object. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: reversed

attribute.description: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the legend. A backgroundColor also needs to be applied for this to take effect. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: shadow

attribute.description: CSS styles for the legend area. In the 1.x versions the position of the legend area was determined by CSS. In 2.x, the position is determined by properties like align, verticalAlign, x and y, but the styles are still parsed for backwards compatibility.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: The vertical alignment of the legend box. Can be one of "top", "middle" or "bottom". Vertical position can be further determined by the y option. Defaults to "bottom".
attribute.name: verticalAlign

attribute.description: The width of the legend box, not including style.padding. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: width

attribute.description: The x offset of the legend relative to it's horizontal alignment align within chart.spacingLeft and chart.spacingRight. Negative x moves it to the left, positive x moves it to the right. The default value of 15 together with align: "center" puts it in the center of the plot area. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: x

attribute.description: The vertical offset of the legend relative to it's vertical alignment verticalAlign within chart.spacingTop and chart.spacingBottom. Negative y moves it up, positive y moves it down. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: y

attribute.description: The color of the tooltip border. When null, the border takes the color of the corresponding series or point. Defaults to "auto".
attribute.name: borderColor

attribute.description: The radius of the rounded border corners. Defaults to 5.
attribute.name: borderRadius

attribute.description: The pixel width of the tooltip border. Defaults to 2.
attribute.name: borderWidth

attribute.description: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.
attribute.name: valueDecimals

attribute.description: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object. Defaults to "".
attribute.name: valuePrefix

attribute.description: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object. Defaults to "".
attribute.name: valueSuffix

attribute.description: When the tooltip is shared, the entire plot area will capture mouse movement, and tooltip texts for all series will be shown in a single bubble. This is recommended for single series charts and for iPad optimized sites. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: shared

attribute.description: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: allowPointSelect

attribute.description:
Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. Since version 2.1, the animation can be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see #chart => animation and the animation parameter under the API methods. The following properties are supported:
duration The duration of the animation in milliseconds. easing When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooToos as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing.
Defaults to true. Try it: Animation disabled, slower animation, easing "easeOutBounce" through jQuery UI.
attribute.name: animation

attribute.description: The main color or the series. In line type series it applies to the line and the point markers unless otherwise specified. In bar type series it applies to the bars unless a color is specified per point. The default value is pulled from the options.colors array. Try it: General plot option, one specific series, area color
attribute.name: color

attribute.description: Whether to connect a graph line across null points. Defaults to false. Try it: False by default, true
attribute.name: connectNulls

attribute.description: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn, event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series. Defaults to 300.
attribute.name: cropThreshold

attribute.description: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked. Defaults to ''. Try it: Pointer cursor on line graph, on columns, on scatter markers
attribute.name: cursor

attribute.description:
A name for the dash style to use for the graph. Applies only to series type having a graph, like line, spline, area and scatter in case it has a lineWidth. The value for the dashStyle include:
Solid ShortDash ShortDot ShortDashDot ShortDashDotDot Dot Dash LongDash DashDot LongDashDot LongDashDotDot
Defaults to null.
attribute.name: dashStyle

attribute.description: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance. Defaults to true.
attribute.name: enableMouseTracking

attribute.description: Pixel with of the graph line. Defaults to 2.
attribute.name: lineWidth

attribute.description: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: pointStart

attribute.description: What part of the string the given position is anchored to. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right". In inverted charts, x axis label alignment and y axis alignment are swapped. Defaults to "center".
attribute.name: align

attribute.description: Enable or disable the axis labels. Defaults to true.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.description: Rotation of the labels in degrees. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: rotation

attribute.description: Horizontal axes only. The number of lines to spread the labels over to make room or tighter labels. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: staggerLines
style

attribute.description: To show only every n'th label on the axis, set the step to n. Setting the step to 2 shows every other label. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: step

attribute.description: The x position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: x

attribute.description: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: y

attribute.description: What part of the string the given position is anchored to. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right". In inverted charts, x axis label alignment and y axis alignment are swapped. Defaults to "center".
attribute.name: align

attribute.description: Enable or disable the axis labels. Defaults to true.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.description: Rotation of the labels in degrees. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: rotation

attribute.description: Horizontal axes only. The number of lines to spread the labels over to make room or tighter labels. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: staggerLines
style

attribute.description: To show only every n'th label on the axis, set the step to n. Setting the step to 2 shows every other label. Defaults to null.
attribute.name: step

attribute.description: The x position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: x

attribute.description: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: y

attribute.description: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. Defaults to 0.
attribute.name: shadow
